speaker: Frasier
text: [_into mike_] It's 4:25 and this is Dr. Frasier Crane.  Roz, who's our next caller?

speaker: Roz
text: We have Hank on line three.  He's having trouble with his neighbors.

speaker: Frasier
text: Hello Hank.  I'm listening.

speaker: Hank
text: Am I on?

speaker: Frasier
text: Yes, you are on the air.

speaker: Hank
text: Hello, am I on?

speaker: Frasier
text: Hank, listen.  Turn down your radio and just talk into your phone.

speaker: Hank
text: Hello?

speaker: Frasier
text: Listen, Hank please, you won't be able to hear yourself, we're on a seven-second delay.

speaker: Hank
text: Hello, can you hear me?

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, for crying out loud. [_hangs up on Hank_] Thank you, Hank. People, would you please turn off your damn radios. [_Roz immediately starts making very large "NO" gestures_] No, I mean just those of you who are calling in!  Roz, who's our next caller?

speaker: Roz
text: We have Marco on line two.  He's having problems with his relationship.

speaker: Frasier
text: Hello Marco.  I'm listening.

speaker: Marco
text: Well, I uh, I started seeing this woman two years ago.  I think it was two years.  Um, it was around Thanksgiving.  Yeah, yeah, yeah, right.  The leaves were off the trees and the...

speaker: Frasier
text: Close enough.  What is your problem, Marco?

speaker: Marco
text: Well, it's not really my problem, it's more like her problem. Lately she keeps pressing me for a commitment.

speaker: Frasier
text: What's holding you back?

speaker: Marco
text: I don't know, I just... I guess I just want to keep my options open.  You know, in case somebody better comes along.

speaker: Frasier
text: "Somebody better comes along."  Somebody better comes along?! Marco, Marco, Marco, do you hear yourself?

speaker: Marco
text: No, I turned my radio off after you blasted that other guy.

speaker: Frasier
text: Well listen, I suggest you give your motives a thorough examination, and if you can't commit, it's best for both of you to break it off.  Thank you for your call. [_hangs up_] Tell me listeners, what is it with guys like that?  Hey Roz, you've been around the block a few times.  You ever run into a guy like Marco?

speaker: Roz
text: Oh, they're all Marcos.  You can't swing a dead cat without hitting a Marco.

speaker: Frasier
text: Come on.  I mean, if that were so, then no-one would be having a relationship.

speaker: Roz
text: Well, I'm not.  My sister's not.  None of my friends are.  I've seen the future, and its name is Marco.

speaker: Frasier
text: What do you think, Seattle?  Are there any non-Marcos out there?  Or is Roz here destined to live a life of hopeless, loveless spinsterhood?  Back after this.

speaker: Roz
text: Gee, I just love it when you include me in your show. **'TWAS TWO MONTHS BEFORE CHRISTMAS...**  _Scene Two: Frasier's apartment. The fireplace is decorated with all the Christmas trappings.  In front of it is a tree to which Martin is hanging a final bauble._

speaker: Martin
text: This is really weird.  It's not even Halloween yet.  Do we really have to do this now?

speaker: Daphne
text: [_setting up a camera_] If we're going to have a picture for the Christmas card, we've got to make it look like Christmas.

speaker: Martin
text: I don't know why we just can't do what my wife and I did - put Frasier and Niles in matching sweaters and sit them on the hood of the old Packard.

speaker: Daphne
text: Well, this year we're going to be a little more artistic, right?

speaker: Martin
text: Where the hell is Frasier anyway?  I could use some help here.

speaker: Daphne
text: He's still napping.  My grandfather used to nap every afternoon. He lived to be ninety-three.

speaker: Martin
text: Really?

speaker: Daphne
text: He'd lie there on the sofa, and you couldn't wake him for the world.  Grammy would say "He might as well be a dead man." Then of course, one day, we couldn't wake him.  He really was a dead man.  Poor Grammy.  For weeks she'd keep insisting, "He's napping, he's napping".

speaker: Martin
text: Okay.  I'm going to turn it on. [_plugs in fairy lights_]

speaker: Daphne
text: Oh, it's lovely.

speaker: Both
text: "Deck the halls with boughs of holly; Fa-la-la-la-la-la-la-la-la! 'Tis the season to be jolly; Fa-la-la-la-la-la-la-la-la!" etc.  _The carol continues as Frasier comes in, still groggy from his nap. He looks around, at a loss._

speaker: Frasier
text: Excuse me, excuse me. [_they stop singing_] Exactly how long have I been asleep?

speaker: Martin
text: Oh good, you're up.  Now we can get this picture taken.

speaker: Frasier
text: What picture?

speaker: Daphne
text: The picture for the Christmas card.  We told you about it last week, remember?

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, oh right.

speaker: Daphne
text: [_handing out woolen hats_] Now the theme this year is "Santa's Workshop."  Everybody put on your little elf hats.

speaker: Frasier
text: I am not putting this on my head.  For God's sake, I mean, I'm a respected professional.

speaker: Martin
text: [_wearing his_] But if you don't, it'll look stupid.

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, I think the ship has already sailed on that one.

speaker: Martin
text: Just put the hat on, Frasier.

speaker: Frasier
text: You can't tell me what to do.

speaker: Martin
text: I am telling you, look, put the hat on.

speaker: Frasier
text: No, look, the days are past when you can just sit me on top of some stupid old Packard and make me wear matching sweaters with my little brother.

speaker: Daphne
text: Boys, boys please.  Don't fight.  Are you forgetting what day it is?

speaker: Frasier
text: It's October 21st!

speaker: Martin
text: Can we just get the picture taken, please?

speaker: Daphne
text: Alright, I've got it all set.  Fifteen seconds, gents. [_realises_] Oh, wait.  There's something missing.  Where's Eddie?

speaker: Martin
text: Oh, he's in the bathroom, getting a drink.  EDDIE!  _To the sound of sleigh bells, Eddie appears.  To Frasier's ire, he has reindeer antlers tied to his head.  The camera flashes._

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, I can always pray there's a postal strike. **M &M;'s AND SYMPATHY**  _Scene Three: Radio Studio Frasier is finishing his show._

speaker: Frasier
text: [_on air_] Well, that's just about it for today.  This is Dr. Frasier Crane, saying go on out there and make it a great evening, Seattle.  _He goes off the air.  Roz enters with one of his studio portraits and a pen._]

speaker: Roz
text: Hey, before you go, there's a fan in the hall who'd like your autograph.

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, God.  Save me from my adoring fans.  _He signs the photo then looks out of the window to see a beautiful woman (Catherine) waving at him._

speaker: Frasier
text: Ooh... ooh, but not from the adorable ones.

speaker: Frasier
text: Hello.  Ah, my producer told me you wanted an autograph.  Ah, how should I make this out?

speaker: Catherine
text: You disgust me!  You parasitic fraud!

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, that's certainly different from the usual "Best Regards." [_moves to escape_]

speaker: Catherine
text: Wait a minute, don't walk away from me.  For once you're going to face the consequences of what happens after you hang up on your callers.

speaker: Frasier
text: What consequences?  What are you talking about?

speaker: Catherine
text: I'm Marco's girlfriend.  Excuse me - ex-girlfriend, thanks to you.

speaker: Frasier
text: Marco?  You mean the Marco who-didn't-want-to-commit Marco?

speaker: Catherine
text: Ah, you damn radio shrinks!  You couldn't just tell him to stick with it.  That kind of advice doesn't get big ratings. No, "break up with her, get on with your life and ruin hers." Now that's entertainment.

speaker: Frasier
text: Now just hold on one minute.  Did you actually listen to the show?

speaker: Catherine
text: ...No.  But Marco told me what you said.

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh he did, did he?  Did he also mention that he said that he was only staying with you to "keep his options open?"  Because that's what he told me.  To be exact, he said he was only staying with you "until somebody better came along."

speaker: Catherine
text: He said that?

speaker: Frasier
text: He said that to most of Seattle.  Apparently you're the only one who missed it.

speaker: Catherine
text: So, it wasn't that he didn't want to commit.  He just didn't want to commit to me. [_starts to cry_]

speaker: Frasier
text: Well I'm... I'm terribly sorry I had to tell you.  But, um, at least now you know the truth.  Oh, no-no-no, don't cry.  You're in a place of business here.  _With his usual tact, he places a folder over the mike to protect it from her tears._

speaker: Catherine
text: Ooh, boy, I can really pick 'em, can't I?

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh no, don't go there.  Look, this is not your fault.  You are a terrifically attractive young woman - I mean, maybe a bit overemotional...

speaker: Catherine
text: [_buries her head in Frasier's shoulder_] OOHH!

speaker: Frasier
text: [_hugging her_] Oh, yes.  There, there.  Shh... listen, can I... can I get you something?

speaker: Catherine
text: No.

speaker: Frasier
text: A drink of water?

speaker: Catherine
text: No.

speaker: Frasier
text: [_lost, looks around and sees the candy machine_] M&M;'s?

speaker: Catherine
text: [_they break_] Plain or peanut?

speaker: Frasier
text: Whichever you like.

speaker: Catherine
text: Peanut.

speaker: Catherine
text: I should have seen this coming.  I mean, the guy practically had a coronary when I brought a toothbrush over to keep at his apartment.

speaker: Frasier
text: [_handing over packet_] Here.

speaker: Catherine
text: Thank you.  You want one?

speaker: Frasier
text: Ah, no thanks.  Ah, why don't you have a seat here. [_indicates chair_]

speaker: Catherine
text: Thank you. [_sits crossed-legged_]

speaker: Frasier
text: But listen, if... if he was that resistant, why did you stay with him?

speaker: Catherine
text: I had a lot invested in him.

speaker: Frasier
text: Yes, but that's no reason to settle for someone who isn't madly in love with you.

speaker: Catherine
text: Well, right now I'm not sure there are any men out there who are actually capable of falling madly in love.

speaker: Frasier
text: Of course there are.  You know, at the most basic level men and women are the same.  We both need to be loved, and to love someone, we both want to feel that we matter to someone and that someone matters to us.  And making a commitment to another human being is the ultimate expression of our humanity.

speaker: Catherine
text: Wow.  Your wife is really lucky.

speaker: Frasier
text: I'm sure she'd say the same thing, especially now that our marriage is over... well, maybe I will have one of those M&M;'s. [_takes packet, helps himself_]

speaker: Catherine
text: Oh, boy.  Why are relationships always so hard?  Hey, [_indicating Frasier's choice of M &M;_] you like the yellow ones too, huh?

speaker: Frasier
text: Yeah.  You know, people try to tell you they're the same but...

speaker: Catherine
text: I know.

speaker: Frasier
text: But they're not.

speaker: Catherine
text: No.

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, you know, relationships don't always have to be so hard. I remember back in med school, I heard of a documented case where a man and a woman met, got along, and actually lived happily ever after.

speaker: Catherine
text: Yeah, I don't mind the happily ever after part.  It's the dating part.  If I have to tell one more stranger the fascinating story of my life over more Italian cuisine I'm gonna choke on a breadstick!

speaker: Frasier
text: [_laughs, then sits crossed-legged as well, mimicking her_] I know. You know, I just keep thinking that maybe we can just resume this over appetizers.

speaker: Catherine
text: Oh, no, no.  Half the time I'm ready to exchange goodbyes over appetizers.

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, at least you don't get stuck with the bill.

speaker: Catherine
text: God, you haven't dated much lately, have you?

speaker: Frasier
text: No.  I usually end up in restaurants alone.

speaker: Catherine
text: Oh, I can't do that.  I even have to turn on the TV at home so at least it feels that there's someone else in the room.

speaker: Frasier
text: Is that what you'll be doing tonight?

speaker: Catherine
text: [_eats an M &M; from Frasier's hand_] Well, unless I just keep eating M&M;'s, which is a distinct possibility.  _Frasier finishes the packet in one go.  FADE TO:_  **KISS ME, KATE**  _Scene Four: Cafe Nervosa. Frasier and Catherine are sitting at a table.  She is reading his palm._

speaker: Frasier
text: "Soft and supple, yet strong, right down to the beautiful almond- shaped nails."  You really see all of that in my hand?

speaker: Catherine
text: Mmm.  I'm late.  I gotta go to work.

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, wait, wait.  We haven't decided what we're gonna do tonight. Ah, Antonio's?  Le Cigar Volante?

speaker: Catherine
text: We've gone out for the last three nights, why don't we just stay in, huh?

speaker: Frasier
text: That's a great idea.  I'll tell you what.  I'll uh, send dad and Daphne off to the movies.  I'll cook for you.  Be at my place at eight.

speaker: Catherine
text: Oh, I won't be able to make it 'til eight-thirty, I gotta change, okay?

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, no-no-no-no.  Don't ever change - I like you just the way you are. [_everybody in the Cafe groans; to group:_] Oh, come on, come on, I'm a little out of practice.

speaker: Catherine
text: I'll see you later, okay?  [_They kiss... a long kiss.  Long enough for Niles to see them through the window._]

speaker: Catherine
text: Bye.

speaker: Niles
text: I'll dispense with the usual adolescent teasing and come straight to the point: who was that babe-o-rama?!

speaker: Frasier
text: Niles, please don't try to be hip.  You remind me of Bob Hope when he dresses up as the Fonz.

speaker: Niles
text: [_to waitress_] Coffee.

speaker: Frasier
text: Her name is Catherine.

speaker: Niles
text: So?  How long have you known her?

speaker: Frasier
text: Three days.

speaker: Niles
text: Have you two, uh...?

speaker: Frasier
text: No.  As if it's any of your business.

speaker: Niles
text: But you're, uh..?

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, yes.  Soon.

speaker: Niles
text: [_nods, then, unsure:_] We are talking about...?

speaker: Frasier
text: Of course we are.

speaker: Niles
text: [_still unsure:_] ...Sex, right?

speaker: Frasier
text: Yes!

speaker: Niles
text: [_his coffee arrives_] Ooh, so-so-so... how did you two meet?

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, I mean, it was one of those funny things, she came down to the radio station to chew me out.

speaker: Niles
text: [_picks up sugar packet and starts shaking it_] You're kidding.

speaker: Frasier
text: No.  A few days earlier her boyfriend had called into the show, and I advised him to break up with her.

speaker: Niles
text: Frasier, Frasier, where are your ethics?  You can't date someone who's involved with one of your patients.

speaker: Frasier
text: Marco is not a patient, he's a caller.  There's a huge difference. Besides, I talked to him days before I met Catherine.

speaker: Niles
text: Mmm, rationalization - the last refuge of the unsound argument.

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, rationalization, is that what you're going pull now?

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh Niles, I am not rationalizing!  There is nothing wrong here.

speaker: Niles
text: As long as your conscience is clear.  I'm not sure mine would be.

speaker: Frasier
text: Well frankly, I don't care about your conscience.  I don't need your approval, I don't need you to like it.  Frankly, I don't need you for anything. [_gets ready to leave_] By the way, Niles, my car's in the shop, I need you to give me a ride home tonight.

speaker: Niles
text: No problem.  _End Of Act One.  Act Two._  **HE'S BAACK**  _Scene One: The radio station, Roz's booth. Frasier enters from corridor._

speaker: Roz
text: Twenty seconds. And I've got news for you: Marco's on line two.

speaker: Frasier
text: [_feigning ignorance_] Marco?

speaker: Roz
text: Oh, you know.  The guy you got out of the way so you could keep his girlfriend for yourself? [_Frasier goes into the recording booth_] Ten seconds.

speaker: Frasier
text: I'm not talking to him.  I don't want to talk to him.  There's no way I'm talking to him.

speaker: Roz
text: Three, two...

speaker: Frasier
text: [_on air_] Hi, we're back.  Roz, whom do we have on the line?

speaker: Roz
text: We have Marco on line two.

speaker: Frasier
text: Who's this on line three?

speaker: Roz
text: Ooh, Todd. [_disconnects line_] Oh darn, we lost Todd. [_Frasier is not amused_] But lucky for you we still have Marco on line two.

speaker: Frasier
text: Thank you, Roz. [_to caller_] Hello, Marco.

speaker: Marco
text: Hi, Dr. Crane.  I spoke to you the other day and I took your advice. I broke up with my girlfriend.

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, what can I say but, ah... Bravo, Marco!  Roz, who's our next caller?  _We cut to Niles, driving in his car.  We can hear Marco through his radio._

speaker: Marco
text: [_on radio:_] Wait, wait-wait-wait.  You haven't heard my problem. I think she's already dating someone else.  It really makes me nuts.

speaker: Frasier
text: What makes you think she's seeing someone else?

speaker: Marco
text: Well, the other night I couldn't get her on the phone.  So I drove by her house, and I saw her parked outside talking to some guy in a black BMW.

speaker: Frasier
text: Did you, ah... get a good look at the guy?

speaker: Marco
text: No.  It was too dark.  I think I made a big mistake, Doc.  Do you think I should ask her to take me back?

speaker: Frasier
text: No!  What I mean is, ah... no.  Marco, you don't want your ex- girlfriend back, you just don't want anybody else to have her. Isn't that true?

speaker: Marco
text: Well, I...

speaker: Frasier
text: No, it's called jealousy, Marco.  Now you've got to stop spying on your ex-girlfriend and get on with your life.  Borrow a page from my book - ah, move to a new city, a new state.  Find out why everybody's talking about Pittsburgh!  _In his car, Niles is shocked.  In the studio, Frasier hangs up on Marco._

speaker: Frasier
text: We'll be right back after these messages.

speaker: Frasier
text: What?! **HOW AM I DRIVING?**  _Scene Two: Niles's car. He has just picked up Frasier._

speaker: Frasier
text: Thanks for coming to get me, Niles.

speaker: Niles
text: No problem, Frasier.  Just a few miles out of my way.  At rush hour.  But I didn't mind, really.  Gave me a chance to listen to your show. [_looks pointedly at Frasier_]

speaker: Frasier
text: I see.

speaker: Niles
text: I just have one question for you: can you honestly tell me that the advice you gave Marco was based on his best interests and not on your own?

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, that's an interesting question, Niles.  And I'll tell you something.  I don't care.  I'm in love, and I don't care.  Catherine is mine now.  I'm in, and Marco's out.

speaker: Niles
text: You're insane.

speaker: Frasier
text: Perhaps.  But you just ran a stop sign. [_Niles slams on the brakes_] Now we're in the middle of the intersection. [_car horns blare, Niles drives on_] I'll tell you, Niles, I, ah... I haven't Felt this way in ages.  There's an excitement about this. I, I feel tingly.

speaker: Niles
text: What's your stomach have to say about this?

speaker: Frasier
text: My stomach?

speaker: Niles
text: I definitely know what I'm talking about.  Ever since you were a child, if you even approached a breach of ethics you'd get queasy.  Actually, you'd get physically sick.

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, at least when it came to ethics I didn't get spontaneous nosebleeds.

speaker: Niles
text: Remember the time we lifted that dollar bill from mom's change purse?  We left quite a gruesome trail back to the tree house that day.

speaker: Frasier
text: Ah, but you see, Niles, you've proved my point.  I'm not the least bit queasy, I'm fine.  My head, my heart, my gastrointestinal system, they're all shouting the same thing - It's okay! [_looks around_] Niles?  Niles, this is a new car?

speaker: Niles
text: Yes, actually it is.  Patient of mine got me a huge break on a lease. [_puts his finger to his nose_] Frasier, do you have a handkerchief? **THE OBLIGATORY SEX SCENE**  _Scene Three: Frasier's Apartment. He and Catherine have just finished their meal and are clearing up._

speaker: Catherine
text: Mmm. That was the most delicious salmon Marseilles I've ever tasted.

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, maybe you should try my "salmon-chanted evening."

speaker: Catherine
text: Oh, no.  Tell me you didn't say that.

speaker: Frasier
text: No, it was just the Laffite talking.  "Laffite don't fail me now."

speaker: Catherine
text: C'mon, stop, stop.  _Catherine gets up and follows him into the kitchen, where he is washing their plates in the sink._

speaker: Catherine
text: So, have you ever made love in the kitchen?

speaker: Frasier
text: [_he drops and smashes a plate in the sink_] Well, the ah, dishes are done.

speaker: Catherine
text: Mmm, ah, ah...

speaker: Frasier
text: Mmm, oh, ah... [_then:_] Aaugh! [_he stands up_]

speaker: Catherine
text: What was that?

speaker: Frasier
text: I'm sorry.  I'm suddenly feeling a little queasy.  Maybe I'm just not a kitchen person.

speaker: Catherine
text: Well ah, maybe you're just a little too warm, huh? [_starts to unbutton his shirt_] Yeah?

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, yeah.

speaker: Catherine
text: Oh, God...

speaker: Frasier
text: Yeah, that's it.  You know, you look awfully warm too.

speaker: Catherine
text: Oh, I am.

speaker: Frasier
text: [_unbuttons her blouse_] Oh, my God.

speaker: Catherine
text: Yes, oh...  _They embrace again, falling onto Martin's chair.  It starts to vibrate. Frasier whacks it and it ceases._

speaker: Frasier
text: I'm sorry.  Would you... would you mind if we, if we moved to the sofa?  I'm not going to be out-performed by a Barcalounger.

speaker: Catherine
text: No. [_they move, Frasier carrying Catherine_]

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, this is good.

speaker: Catherine
text: Yes, it is.

speaker: Frasier
text: This is better

speaker: Catherine
text: Oh...

speaker: Frasier
text: Eee-ugh!

speaker: Catherine
text: What?!  Was I kneeling on you?

speaker: Frasier
text: Really, maybe I need some fresh air. [_moves to balcony_] Are you okay?

speaker: Catherine
text: Oh, I'm fine, I'm fine.

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh damn, it wasn't the fish!

speaker: Catherine
text: You know there's a bug going round.

speaker: Frasier
text: It's not a bug.

speaker: Catherine
text: Well what is it, then?

speaker: Frasier
text: It's us.  Every time we touch and kiss I get queasy.

speaker: Catherine
text: What are you telling me?  That the thought of making love to me makes you sick to your stomach?

speaker: Frasier
text: Yes, but don't take it personally!

speaker: Catherine
text: [_sarcastic_] Well, why would I?

speaker: Frasier
text: It's, it's not you.  Ah, it's, it's me.  Every time I come close to breaching my ethics, I-I end up getting sick.

speaker: Catherine
text: What are you talking about?

speaker: Frasier
text: Marco called into the show today and... he said he was thinking of getting back with you and I told him not to.

speaker: Catherine
text: So?

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, I just have a feeling that... maybe I told him that not because it was good for him, but because it was good for me.

speaker: Catherine
text: Oh, Frasier, who cares? [_kisses him_]

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, I do.  I care.  You know?  Look, any psychiatrist worth his salt would care.  That's why we don't get involved with our patients.  Or their girlfriends.

speaker: Catherine
text: Are you, are you saying you want to break up with me?

speaker: Frasier
text: No, I don't want to.  I have to.  If I don't, I'll throw up all over your shoes.

speaker: Catherine
text: I can't believe this is happening.  God, how can this be so easy for you?

speaker: Frasier
text: Easy?!  This is killing me!  You think I don't want to pick you up right now, carry you over to that Eames classic and show you why it's the best-engineered chair in the world?!

speaker: Catherine
text: Well, why don't you then?

speaker: Frasier
text: I told you, I can't.

speaker: Catherine
text: Oh!  And nothing I can say will change your mind?

speaker: Frasier
text: I'm sorry.

speaker: Catherine
text: Well thank you, Dr. Crane!  First you screw things up with Marco, and now you're dumping me?  God!  And to think I was going to have sex with you. [_twisting the knife_] And it was going to be hot.  Oh, like you've never had before.  I'm talking raw, steamy, sweat-dripping-down-your-back, neighbors- pounding-on-the-wall, ILLEGAL-IN-FORTY-EIGHT-STATES-KIND-OF-SEX! But, hey!  You're okay, you won't be alone tonight.  No, you've got your ETHICS!

speaker: Catherine
text: Oh, by the way... the fish was dry. [_exits_]

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, that was a cheap shot!

speaker: Frasier
text: How I envy you, Eddie.  The biggest questions you face are "who's going to walk me?"  "Who's going to feed me?"  I won't know that kind of joy for another forty years.
